head.supplied: 16th April 1880 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor by direction of His Excellency to inform you that the Governor has received a despatch from the Right Honorable the Secretary of State for the Colonies in ...

div.p: Unit 4, pp. 219-20, VPRS 1092 Governor's letter books, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor by direction of His Excellency to inform you that the Governor has received a despatch from the Right Honorable the Secretary of State for the Colonies in which he is desired to convey to you an expression of thanks from the Prince of Wales for the present which you were so good as to transmit for His Royal Highness's acceptance and that His Royal Highness will be happy to accept the dedication of your work on the Eucalyptus trees in Australia
The final Decade of M's Eucalyptograpohia (B84.13.19) included a dedication page to His Royal Highness Albert Edward, Prince of Wales.
